title: Synchronized Submissions
description: Multiple nodes can coordinate to submit observations, proposals, or civic statements on the same day or theme, amplifying visibility without central oversight.

title: Global Observation Weeks
description: Nodes choose a shared theme (e.g., education, migration, climate) and document related activity simultaneously, building horizontal awareness patterns.

title: Presence-Driven Petitions
description: Instead of counting signatures, nodes log participation presence for civic issues. Visibility and engagement itself become the measure of impact.

title: Cross-Node Amplification
description: Participants link, mirror, or reference content from other nodes to create emergent resonance across regions and scales.

title: Optional Coordination Tools
description: Nodes may use shared calendars, tags, or lightweight templates to synchronize actions. These tools are optional and designed to support autonomy, not enforce hierarchy.
